programme.title: Keep Going
programme.desc: Sybille is a divorced mother seeking to reconnect with her violent drifting son, Samuel. As a last resort, she takes him on a horse trip across Kyrgyzstan, facing its magnificent yet hostile natural environment, its people… and above all each other.

programme.title: You Are Not Alone
programme.desc: When Eva returns to her house on the day of her divorce, she finds a bouquet of red roses outside the door. Attached is the note: "You are not alone." The sender is anonymous.

programme.title: Lemonade
programme.desc: Mara, a young Romanian mother, is a caretaker in the US on a temporary visa. Life seemed perfect after she got married and brought her son over. However, she faces abuses of power from the officer in her green card process, who seeks to exploit her plight.

programme.title: Masha
programme.desc: Masha has grown up between the boxing ring and the streets of her provincial Russian town. Her closest friends, young gangsters who are loathed by the entire town, love and protect her. And suddenly the cruel truth about them is revealed to her.

programme.title: Mammal
programme.desc: Margaret (Rachel Griffiths), a silently grieving divorcee forms an intense bond with Joe (Barry Keoghan), a homeless youth. Their oedipal relationship is threatened by the wrath of Margaret’s ex-husband and Joe’s involvement with a gang of violent youths.

programme.title: SAF
programme.desc: Desperate, Kamil takes a low wage job in Istanbul's urbanization project. In so doing, he displaces a Syrian refugee and partakes in his neighborhood’s destruction, while also needing to pay for the required permits. One day, Kamil suddenly disappears.

programme.title: A Murder Of Crows Jealousy
programme.desc: Inspector Bruhl is investigating the abduction of a young boy from a playground, until evidence suggests that the boy doesn’t exist at all. Is he a figment of the alleged mother’s fractured reality, or are answers buried in her traumatic past?

programme.title: Summer Rebels
programme.desc: Young Jonas wants to visit his cool grandpa in Slovakia for a summer of fun, but his mom has other plans. Undeterred, Jonas takes off on an adventure of his own in this luminous and light-hearted tale of rebellion, friendship, catastrophe and redemption.

programme.title: Not My Type
programme.desc: A dashing philosopher is sent off to teach in a quiet northern town, where he soon falls for a bubbly and rather vulgar local hairdresser. But will the couple’s carnal affection manage to overcome their irreconcilable differences?

programme.title: Remember To Blink
programme.desc: Jacqueline adopts two children from a foreign country with her husband. To help with translation, the kids are accompanied by Gabriele, a twenty-year old who is just starting to taste the sweetness of feeling power.

programme.title: Red Eagle
programme.desc: A Summit between France, England, Portugal and the Pope is to take place in Spain, under the guise of looking for a solution to the conflict between Spain and Portugal; but the ulterior motive is to attack the Kingdom of Spain.

programme.title: Murders in Dinard
programme.desc: The seaside resort of Dinard prepares for a British film festival when the body of a young English director is discovered floating. He had been the victim of a shipwreck in which his teenage sister had died. Are these two events linked?

programme.title: The Valley
programme.desc: After surviving a car crash in the middle of Lebanon’s isolated Beqaa Valley, an amnesiac man finds himself held hostage on a local farm that doubles as an illegal drug-production facility.

programme.title: Run Woman Run
programme.desc: When a steady diet of donuts, pizza, cake and cigarettes lands Beck in a diabetic coma, she receives a ghostly life coach in the form of legendary marathon hero Tom Longboat who helps her train for the run of her life.
